alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound; Southeast Prince William Sound; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 5:47PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS TO CONTINUE ACROSS COASTAL SOUTHCENTRAL ALASKA THROUGH THURSDAY... A complex area of low pressure in the western Gulf of Alaska will continue to push bands of snow showers north from the Gulf of Alaska across the Southcentral coast. The first of these bands has already moved from eastern Prince William Sound to Portage Valley, with several inches of snow for locations from Cordova to Portage and Wittier. A second round of snow showers is expected to move through the region this evening and a third expected for early Thursday morning. These snow showers may be heavy at times with snowfall rates of up to one and half inches of snow per hour. Visibilities within heavier snow showers may also fall to as low as one quarter mile at times. For locations where these heavier snow showers persist, several additional inches of snow are possible. These bands of snow showers are expected to diminish in intensity and taper off from east to west across Prince William Sound and the eastern Kenai Peninsula through the day Thursday. Motorists are urged to slow down and use caution.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Prince William Sound; Southeast Prince William Sound; Western Prince William Sound
